qc.notes: Good focus and indirect daylight. A small metallic sticker partially occludes one nasal area but does not prevent assessment.

skin_type.label: combination
skin_type.rationale: Visible pores and slight shine on the T-zone with smoother, more matte outer cheeks and jaw.

skin_tone_fitzpatrick.label: III
skin_tone_fitzpatrick.note: Estimated from light–medium baseline in natural light; camera/lighting can shift appearance.

skin_age_range.rationale: Few static lines, smooth texture, and mild under-eye changes suggest early 30s appearance.

analysis.overview_explanation: Balanced skin with T-zone-focused pores, mild under-eye darkness, and light scattered pigmentation. Texture is mostly smooth and acne activity is low.

pores.rationale_plain: Pores are clearly visible on the nose and extend to the medial cheeks. Forehead and jaw show smaller, less dense pores, fitting a T-zone predominant pattern.
possible_causes: Genetic pore size with higher T-zone oil output.
Heat, UV and urban pollution can oxidize sebum and accentuate pore edges.
Harsh cleansing can trigger rebound oil and make pores appear larger.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Greatest pore prominence on the nose with spillover onto the inner cheeks.
likely_causes: Sebaceous gland density is highest in the T-zone.
Heat and humidity increase oil flow.
care_education: Use a gentle daily cleanser and avoid harsh scrubs.
Add a leave-on BHA (salicylic acid 0.5–2%) several nights per week and use daily broad-spectrum sunscreen.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Many closely spaced openings on the nasal tip/dorsum.
care_education: Stay consistent with BHA and gentle moisturization.
Expect gradual changes rather than abrupt shrinking.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Blackhead-like dots on the nose and a small nearby papule imply intermittent clogging.
likely_causes: Incomplete removal of sunscreen/makeup and daily pollutants.
Touching or picking increases debris retention.
care_education: Double cleanse at night when needed and alternate BHA with a retinoid once tolerated.
Avoid manual extraction at home to minimize marks.

citations.title: AI grading of enlarged pores (Dermatol Ther, 2024)

pores.uncertainty_notes: Small metallic sticker occludes a limited nasal area.

wrinkles.rationale_plain: No deep or long lines at rest on the forehead or between the brows. Only fine creasing under the eyes is visible.
possible_causes: Intrinsic aging begins fine peri-ocular lines in the 30s.
UV and squinting can advance lines even when not yet visible at rest.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Very fine creases under the eyes without deep folds.
likely_causes: Thin periorbital skin shows fine lines earlier.
Mild dehydration from AC or environment.
care_education: Use hydrating eye products and SPF; wear sunglasses outdoors.
Consider gradual introduction of a retinoid at night if tolerated.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Static lines are absent; dynamic lines were not tested but are likely minimal.
care_education: Sun protection and moisturization help delay static lines.
Avoid over-drying products that accentuate fine lines.

wrinkles.uncertainty_notes: No expression photos; lighting may soften faint lines.

pigmentation.rationale_plain: Light speckled macules on the nose/upper cheeks and a few small darker spots on the chin consistent with post-blemish change. No large patches.
possible_causes: Cumulative sun exposure in a bright climate.
Marks from prior minor breakouts and occasional picking.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Small, speckled macules over the nose and upper cheeks.
care_education: Daily broad-spectrum SPF 30+ and shade/hat use.
Brightening with vitamin C, azelaic acid or niacinamide can help even tone.

identified_subtypes.explanation: A few residual dark spots on the chin track the pattern of prior blemishes.
likely_causes: Inflammation from pimples leaves lingering pigment.
care_education: Hands-off approach and gentle routine.
Night retinoid and/or azelaic acid with strict SPF to prevent re-darkening.

pigmentation.uncertainty_notes: Reflections can mask very faint differences.

redness.rationale_plain: Mild central redness focused at the sides of the nose and inner cheeks, without confluent spread.
possible_causes: Heat, exercise or spicy food can temporarily increase facial redness.
Over-exfoliation or fragrance can irritate and sustain a mild flush.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Warmer tone mainly on nose and central cheeks.
care_education: Use gentle, fragrance-light products and daily SPF.
Track personal triggers and avoid rubbing.

identified_subtypes.explanation: More visible around nasal creases than across cheeks.
care_education: Pat products on and cleanse gently around creases.
Support barrier with a light moisturizer.

redness.uncertainty_notes: Single lighting and time; momentary flush varies.

texture.rationale_plain: Mostly smooth surface with a fine grain around the nose and inner cheeks. No coarse roughness or flaking was seen.
possible_causes: Micro-comedone and dead-skin buildup in the T-zone.
Environmental pollutants and sunscreen residues if not fully removed.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Fine bumps and micro-relief irregularity near the nose/medial cheeks.
care_education: Use BHA 3–5 nights/week or a gentle PHA if sensitive.
Keep cleanser gentle; moisturize to protect barrier.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Outer cheeks and jaw appear smooth and even.
likely_causes: Balanced oil production outside the T-zone.
care_education: Maintain simple cleanse–treat–moisturize–SPF routine.
Avoid stacking multiple exfoliants on the same night.

texture.uncertainty_notes: Specular highlights can exaggerate or hide grain.

acne.rationale_plain: A few comedonal candidates on the nose and one small inflammatory papule near the mid-face; no nodules/cysts or clusters.
possible_causes: T-zone oil and periodic occlusion from sweat or masks.
Incomplete removal of sunscreen/makeup or cycle-related flares.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Dark-centered dots on the nose suggest open comedones.
likely_causes: Build-up of dead skin and debris.
care_education: Nightly or near-nightly BHA and gentle double cleansing on makeup/sunscreen days.
Avoid squeezing to reduce risk of marks.

identified_subtypes.explanation: One small red bump near the nose is visible.
likely_causes: Friction or sweat may aggravate lesions.
care_education: Use a low-strength benzoyl peroxide as a short-contact or spot treatment.
Seek a clinician if lesions become frequent, painful, or start scarring.

citations.title: Review of acne grading scales incl. GAGS

acne.uncertainty_notes: Single-day snapshot; cycle timing not provided.

under_eye.rationale_plain: Under-eye regions are darker than adjacent cheek with a mild hollow/shadow; right side is slightly deeper.
possible_causes: Thin, transparent eyelid skin revealing underlying vessels.
Anatomical tear-trough shaping that casts shadows.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Hue and translucency suggest vessel show-through more than brown pigment.
likely_causes: Fatigue or allergies can intensify coloration.
care_education: Hydrate gently, apply daily SPF, and consider cool compresses and caffeine-type topicals.
Avoid rubbing; consult a clinician if dark circles are long-standing or worsening.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Subtle tear-trough depth creates shadowing especially on the right.
likely_causes: Normal anatomic contour and soft-tissue distribution.
care_education: Topicals improve skin quality but cannot fill hollows.
In-person consultation can discuss procedural options if desired.

citations.title: Validated photonumeric scale for infraorbital dark circles

under_eye.uncertainty_notes: Under-eye shadows vary with head tilt and time of day.

region_summaries.summary_plain: Smooth, minimal lines and fine pores. Tone looks even without notable spots.
Calm skin between brows with small pores and no visible lines at rest.
Clear under-eye darkening with fine superficial lines; no puffiness.
Similar to left but slightly deeper shadowing along the tear trough.
Mostly smooth; mild pore grain near the nose and a few faint marks.
Slightly more visible pores than the left near the nose; otherwise even.
Most prominent pores and a few blackhead-like dots with mild localized redness.
Quiet, smooth area with minimal texture or color change.
Smooth with a couple of faint post-blemish marks; pores mild.
Clear and even; pores are small and texture is smooth.
Similarly clear with smooth texture and minimal markings.

limitations: Single lighting setup; color rendering can vary across sessions.
No expression photos; dynamic lines not assessed.
Small nasal area occluded by a metallic sticker.
Photos are a single-day snapshot and do not capture cycle or seasonal variation.
